page.title: 01GAZETEER.
page.content: Eyam and Stoney Middleton are quiet villages situated in Derbyshire, within the Peak District National Park ,just 12 miles from Sheffield. Bakewell,the local market town is 7 miles distance. Eyam has a population of approximately 1000 whilst Stoney Middleton has around 500. Eyam is famous for its connection with the Great Plague of 1665. Most of the area is given over to grassland or woodland.There are also a number of quarries extracting florspar or limestone.There was in the past, an important lead mining industry. Today employment is varied and many people live in the area but work outside.Unemployment in 1985 is not a serious problem.
